intro: Myagrum perenne, commonly known as the everlasting heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in spring. Its leaves are narrow, leathery, and arranged in whorls around the stems. Myagrum perenne is well adapted to acidic, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas.
